message: #10054 "Yellow fever" has been a contentious topic around MIT for a while now, and I'm not sure how to parse the jokes and discussion in a healthy way. Like personally, I think it's absurd and disrespectful to seek people strictly because they're asian and turn down those who aren't. At the same time, the last couple people I have been into have demonstrated really kind hearts and fun attitudes , _and_ I find them attractive. Unfortunately sometimes the muddle of jokes and discussion make me feel bad about liking them just because they happen to be asian...
#10055 This Thanksgiving, I'm thankful for PNR.
#10040 Does anyone else panic for a moment like “oh god what if this food baby is actually a real baby” and then remember you haven’t gotten laid in a year

#10035 MIT Confessions is like freshmen -- relatively positive, uplifting, interesting, respectful, content that doesn't hurt people emotionally

MIT Timely Confessions is like sophomore spring -- jaded, depressed, mean to  other people, content that hurts people's feelings emotionally
#10037 My boyfriend and I got in our first real fight and it was over whose memes were better...
#10053 Dear girl at the party, if you have time to spend two hours on a bus every day just to go to 6.0001 lecture don't talk to me about how "Wellesley is probably even harder than MIT!!!"
#10033 never been to phi sig before this year but low key phi sig fire & ice last night put primal to shame
#10036 @9934: everyone who feels like they have to play matchmaker, just tag both people in the original confession. Let's see what happens ;)
#10049 Frankie Soucy more like Frankie SAUCY

#10038 As a black person, I'm somewhat worried that the BSU's "Ask a Black Person" booth/Facebook page gives off the impression that our opinions and feelings are monolithic, and that asking a few black people or getting a response from that Facebook page (and that page definitely does not represent all black views) is sufficient for getting an understanding as to how black people feel. I hope everyone, including the BSU, realize that asking any handful of black people how they feel about a topic is not inherently representative of the opinions of black people as a whole, and that it is important to try to convey the diversity of black opinion (e.g. many blacks are fine with the idea of non-blacks wearing dreads)
#10047 I was gonna become a porn star if I didn't get into MIT
